page.title: 15Marlow Bottom - 2
page.content:
{History of Marlow Bottom Before World War II the valley was mostly scrubland, open fields and shacks. Most of the shacks were thrown up as holiday and weekend homes belonging to people who lived and worked in London. Most of these shacks were turned into houses, but a few remained. The houses grew in number based around one dirt track which is now Marlow Bottom Road. (Tarmacadam was only put down in 1970)
The pre-war residents didn't mind the newcomers but they didn't want street lights. Eventually the street lights went up and{Marlow Bottom}took on a new character.
There are now about three thousand houses when originally there were only about one hundred and fifty shacks.
